Description: Oval pottery bowl of black top brown ware with round base, made of fine Nile silt clay, fired drab brown with blackening at the rim and interior. The exterior is combed vertically and burnished creating a rippled effect. The interior is scatter burnished horizontally. Walls are 6mm thick.
Curator's comments: Similar to Badarian Black-top Brown ware type BB64m in Brunton and Caton-Thompson 1928.
Condition: fair (lip of bowl chipped), reconstructed from fragments, base worn.
